text: The Revlon Salon One Step Hair Dryer and Volumizer with Titanium Coating is a game-changer for hair-loving women, making it an excellent gift option. This innovative tool combines the power of a hair dryer and a volumizer, simplifying the hair styling process and delivering salon-worthy results at home.The titanium coating of the brush ensures smooth and shiny hair, reducing frizz and static. Its unique design allows for effortless detangling and increased volume, giving hair a natural bounce and fullness.One of the standout features of this hair dryer and volumizer is its versatility. It offers multiple heat and speed settings, catering to various hair types and styling preferences. The ergonomic design provides comfort during use, reducing strain on the hand and arm.With the Revlon Salon One Step Hair Dryer and Volumizer, achieving a flawless blowout has never been easier. Its innovative technology and impressive results make it a wonderful gift choice for hair-loving women who want salon-quality hair in the comfort of their own homes.
title: The Perfect Gift for Hair-Loving Women

text: I have ordered this product from Amazon. After I saw the comments I thought this is not the original Revlon hair dryer and I regretted my purchase. However I had to send it back as I have already used my Media Markt product. The supplier is trustworthy.The product is not the best hair styler I have seen. My half priced Grunding makes a better job in half of the time. However I decided to keep the product. It styles the hair in a very natural way. It has a very good grip to the hair. It doesn't get as hot as my Grunding one. At the end my hair doesn't look salon-done but more like naturally I have straight hair. The hair is so soft and shiny.  I like the way it looks in the next days.First time I used on towel dried hair and it really took long time to complete. Now I wait 1-2 hours after shower to use it.One disadvantage of the product is that, it is not possible to switch on and off with one hand. text: This is a really nice tool. I don't even own a hair dryer, because I have so much hair it takes ages for me to dry all the spots and afterwards it looks much worse than if I let them dry on their own. I knew blowing my hair while brushing with a big brush would give amazing results, but honestly it's too heavy of a workout for a clumsy person like me - it would be difficult, tiring and then leave me all sweaty. It's just not something I can commit to, especially when stressing before going out. That's why I was excited to hear about one device that would kind of do both! And it was getting such great reviews. Mind that for the good review rates, the price is much lower than similar products from fancy brands like ghd or dyson.The brush is great and I am quite happy with my purchase. It gives me the same result as getting my hair blown with a thorough brush work at a hairdresser, which is amazing. It is very easy to operate and doesn't let you burn yourself no matter how clumsy you are. Many reviewers here and on YT say that you should not start right after washing your hair, but when it's almost dry, as it takes so long. Well my hair takes extremely long to dry but this device definitely handles it much quicker, for me waiting isn't really necessary, as long as I dry my hair with a towel first (try paper towels for even better results). I only wish it was a bit lighter, it does require some effort to keep it in the air, which I heard isn't an issue with expensive models like dyson. Still, I just don't think that makes them worth the price difference.
title: Good deal on great results

text: This is an honest review.I have a mid-lenght medium thick hair which is wavy when dried naturally. I'm very impressed so far. It took me about 15 minutes to do my hair and I would recommend using a normal hair dryer (or leaving the hair dry naturally) first little bit longer so it's only little bit moist (almost dry). It would definitely shorter the drying time. I mostly used the lower heat, the high heat sounds like an airplane taking off :)It glides through hair quite nicely, I didn't even have to brush it. It goes all the way to the roots lifting them so it makes it very full and bouncy. I also own an automatically rotating brush but I didn't mind at all rotating it myself, at least you can control it better. I love everything anout this, there is only one downside - it is quite heavy and when you have your hands in the air most of the time, I had to take a rest couple of times. But it feels sturdy and I hope it will last long.When I came back from the bathroom, my boyfriend said I look like I just came back from a hairdresser. So I guess he didn't mind me spending that money after all :)
title: Impressed - honest review

text: .Amazon Produkt-Bezeichnung :Revlon One-Step Volumiser Plus (Abnehmbarer Kopf, Keramik-Titan-Platte, Gemischte Styling-Borsten mit Aktivkohle-Pins, Turmalin Ionic Technology), RVDR5298Ebestellt : Mo. 13. Juni 2022geliefert : Di. 14. Juni 2022 (mit Amazon Logistics)der Preis betrug damals 69,99 ‚Ç¨...Die meisten Informationen erh√§lt man ja bereits, wenn man sich den Text und die Bilder in der Amazon-Produktbeschreibung anschaut, und die anderen Rezensionen liest. Es macht sicher wenig Sinn, hier alles zu wiederholen, deshalb fasse ich mich kurz:Ich benutze Warmluftb√ºrsten, um mehr Volumen in mein relativ d√ºnnes, glattes schulter-langes Haar zu bekommen. Das klappt ganz gut ‚Äì allerdings mit der hier rezensierten auch nicht besser als mit meiner bisherigen Warmluftb√ºrste, die im M√§rz '22 gerade mal 26,99 ‚Ç¨ gekostet hatte.Als mir Amazon die jetzt aktuelle B√ºrste zum testen anbot, habe ich gerne zugegriffen, weil ich neugierig war, was eine mehr als doppelt so teuere B√ºrste besser kann.Um das Ergebnis gleich vorweg zu nehmen: Sie kann eigentlich nichts besser.Davon abgesehen, dass das Kabel bei der teueren um ca. ¬Ω Meter l√§nger ist, und dass man sie in 2 Teile zerlegen kann, sind sich die beiden Ger√§te fast zum verwechseln √§hnlich.Auch in der Verarbeitungs-Qualit√§t nehmen sie sich nichts. Es sind beides professionell verarbeitete Massen-Produkte, wie sie t√§glich zu tausenden irgendwo in China von den Flie√üb√§ndern purzeln.Warum hier allerdings eine Rezensentin glaubt, ein Ger√§t von Rowenta vor sich zu haben, kann ich leider nicht nachvollziehen. Vielleicht liegt's am hohen Preis, der nur durch ein Markenger√§t gerechtfertigt w√§re,oder es werden auf dieser Seite wieder mal v√∂llig unterschiedliche Ger√§te rezensiert.Amazon mischt ja gerne mal unterschiedliche Ger√§te zusammen, die eigentlich gar nicht zusammengeh√∂ren. Aber sei's drum. Ich werde das hier nicht ergr√ºnden.Meine beiden Ger√§te haben ein √§hnliches Gewicht, eine √§hnliche Gr√∂√üe, und auch die Lautst√§rke ist fast gleich.Ein Unterschied ist mir aber noch aufgefallen:W√§hrend ich den Schiebe-Schalter des billigen Ger√§tes mit einer Hand bedienen kann, brauche ich f√ºr den Dreh-Schalter des teuren Ger√§tes zwangsl√§ufig 2 H√§nde.Sollten einige Leserinnen jetzt neugierig auf das billigere Ger√§t geworden sein, muss ich sie leider entt√§uschen. Das Ger√§t ist ‚Äì laut Original-Text Amazon:‚ÄúDerzeit nicht verf√ºgbar.Ob und wann dieser Artikel wieder vorr√§tig sein wird, ist unbekannt‚Äú.Schade.Kurz noch zur Anwendung:Ich benutze die Warmluftb√ºrsten nach dem Haare waschen. Es geht am besten, wenn das Haar nicht mehr nass, sondern nur noch leicht feucht ist.Mein Eindruck ist au√üerdem, dass die Ger√§te wegen der recht gro√üen B√ºrstenk√∂pfe eher f√ºr langes und mittellanges Haar geeignet sind. Meine Schwiegermutter ‚Äì(Haar-L√§nge ca. 10 cm, glatt, d√ºnn)‚Äì kann mit meinen beiden Ger√§ten √ºberhaupt nichts anfangen.Aber ich merke gerade, dass ich schon wieder viel zu viel schreibe. Reine Zeitverschwendung. Denn aus mehrj√§hriger Erfahrung wei√ü ich inzwischen, dass die Rezensionen hier fast niemand liest. Die Leute schauen nur, wie viele Sterne ein Produkt hat, und das war's dann.Deshalb komme ich jetzt schnell zum Schluss:Das Revlon One-Step Volumiser Plus ist ein gutes Ger√§t ‚Äì deshalb bekommt es von mir 4 Sterne.Wer allerdings sparen m√∂chte, kann sicher auch f√ºr weniger Geld ein brauchbares Ger√§t finden.MfG , Tanja D..

text: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠êDer One-Step Volumiser Plus wird mit einer deutschen Anleitung geliefert.Er besteht aus zwei Teilen - dem Handgriff mit recht langem, fest angebrachten Stromkabel und dem B√ºrstenkopf.Das Ger√§t besteht komplett aus Kunststoff und ist gut verarbeitet.Der Griff hat an der Oberseite eine Verriegelung, mit der man die B√ºrste anbringt und sichert.Unten gibt es einen Drehregler, mit dem man das Ger√§t einschaltet/ausschaltet und die einzelnen Stufen (K√ºhl, lauwarm, warm, hei√ü) einstellt.Der B√ºrstenkopf hat B√ºrsten und Aktivkohle-Pins.Das Anbringen des B√ºrstenkopfes ist sehr einfach und wird anhand einer kleinen Karte erkl√§rt.Das Einschalten klappt mit dem Drehregler intuitiv und das Ger√§t h√§lt sich einfach und angenehm in der Hand.Das Betriebsger√§usch ist je nach Stufe schon recht laut, aber das liegt halt in der Natur der Sache.Das Trocknen und Stylen mit dem Ger√§t klappt sehr gut. Meine Mutter und ich konnten uns die Haare wirklich sehr toll stylen. Das Handling geht mit dem Ger√§t auch sehr einfach - auch √ºber l√§ngere Zeit.Das Problem der fr√ºheren Version, die einen UK-Adapter auf dem EU-Stromstecker angebracht hatte, ist Geschichte - man hat nun einen normalen EU-Stromstecker.Das Ger√§t ist gut gemacht und l√§sst sich auch einfach nutzen. Das Ergebnis kann sich sehen lassen und preislich ist das Ger√§t auch ok.Empfehlenswert!‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

text: Gute B√ºrste f√ºr schnelle Ergebnisse 4‚≠êIch muss sagen ich war nie der Typ f√ºr Haarstyling, da ich sehr dickes Haar habe und es wirklich sehr schwer war diese zu b√§ndigen.Durch die genaue Anleitung zum Stylen der Haare in der Beschreibung die man schon vor dem Kauf sehen konnte wollte ich es unbedingt mal probieren.Die B√ºrste kam sehr schnell an und ich legte sofort los.Es war zwar bisschen kompliziert am Anfang rauszufinden wie genau man die benutz aber durch die Anleitung versteht man das schnell.Ich finde es super dass man die B√ºrste an die Haarstruktur anpassen kann.Sowohl f√ºr feines als auch f√ºr dickes Haar, man kann es wirklich f√ºr viele Haartypen nutzen.Ich habe meine Haare gestylt und das Ergebnis hat auch wirklich l√§nger gehalten als bei den Ger√§ten zu vor!Desto √∂fter ich es benutze umso besser werden die Ergebnisse.Ich bin froh dar√ºber dieses Ger√§t gekauft zu haben auch wenn der Preis meiner Meinung nach etwas zu viel ist.Aber ich glaube meiner Begeisterung sieht man an, dass es sich gelohnt hat‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ Ich versuche meine Bewertungen so ausf√ºhrlich und informativ wie m√∂glich zu gestalten und meine ehrliche Meinung abzugeben, um Amazon Kunden die Entscheidung zu erleichtern und Ihnen einen kleinen Einblick f√ºr den Gebrauch des Produktes zu erm√∂glichen.  Vielen Dank, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, meine Rezension zu lesen.Ich hoffe, dass ich Ihnen damit ein wenig helfen konnte. Mit freundlichen Gr√º√üen  Nat  ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ

text: üéåZu meiner Ausgangslage:Ich habe feine bis dicke Haare, da ich Tape Extensions habe. Sie sind brustlang.  Die Tapes sind zwar st√∂rend am Haaransatz. Aber am Oberkopf nicht vorhanden. Ich konnte die B√ºrste also auf Volumen, Wellen/C-Shape Locken, Trocknen und Gl√§tten testen.Erst das Positive:‚úîÔ∏è Das Produkt kam schnell an, da es mit Prime bestellt wurde.‚úîÔ∏è Der Stecker hat einen integrierten Adapter f√ºr Europa und USA. Sehr praktisch.‚úîÔ∏è Wertig verarbeitete B√ºrste‚úîÔ∏è Haare werden relativ schnell trocken‚úîÔ∏è Drehen funktioniert gut aus dem Handgelenk. Eine rotierende B√ºrste ist nicht n√∂tig, vor allem, wenn man Erfahrung beim Locken machen mit Gl√§tteisen hat.‚úîÔ∏è Haare werden glatt, wenn man nur runter b√ºrstet. Sie liegen sch√∂n an.Jetzt das, was mir leider negativ aufgefallen ist:‚ùå Die B√ºrste ist sehr gro√ü und kann damit unhandlich werden, wenn man unerfahren ist.‚ùå Der Durchmesser des Kopfs ist auch zu gro√ü f√ºr Locken oder √§hnliches. Ganz leichte Wellen ergeben sich nur an den Spitzen. F√ºr einen C-Shape Cut ist das wohl gerade gut.‚ùå Nicht f√ºr feine Haare geeignet.‚ùå Haare m√ºssen bereits fast zu 90% trocken sein. Minimal feucht, wenn man mit der Hand rein geht. Als ob man nicht sicher ist, ob sie ganz trocken sind.‚ùå ACHTUNG: Das Titanium kann die Haare extrem kaputt machen. Man darf h√∂chstens 2 Mal durch die Haare gehen und das auch recht z√ºgig (wie beim Gl√§tteisen). Wenn dann keine Locken entstanden sind, wird es auch nichts mehr. Man sollte die Str√§hne dann nicht weiter aufheizen. Friseure empfehlen Titanium nicht f√ºr unerfahrene NutzerInnen.‚ùå Preis ist zu hoch. Ich habe die B√ºrste f√ºr 50‚Ç¨ bestellt und werde sie auch zur√ºckschicken, da sie nicht die gew√ºnschten Wellen oder das Volumen erzeugt.üèÅGesamt:Drei von F√ºnf Sternen, weil es f√ºr einige funktionieren k√∂nnte, wenn sie die richtige Haarstruktur und Erfahrung haben.‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ
title: Trocknet Haare aus. Keine Wellen

text: ü§ç Verpackung und LieferumfangDie F√∂hnb√ºrste, wie ich den Volumiser zu nennen pflege, kommt in einer wei√üen Pappschachtel mit aufgedruckten Produktbildern und -informationen daher. Nat√ºrlich wird alles in einer neutralen Amazon Umverpackung geliefert, und so war die Revlon-Box beim Auspacken unversehrt und in perfektem Zustand.Wenn man sie √∂ffnet, wundert man sich zuallererst √ºber die unerwartete Gr√∂√üe des darin befindlichen Produktes. Der ‚ÄúHaartockner und Volumiser‚Äù f√ºllt die gesamte Diagonale der Schachtel aus.Wenn man die Abdeckung entfernt, entdeckt man die darunter versteckten Accessoires:‚Ä¢ 1 Gebrauchsanleitung‚Ä¢ 1 Stromkabel mit variablem EU und GB Netzteil (ich war am Anfang konsterniert, da ich dachte, man h√§tte mir f√§lschlicherweise ein Produkt f√ºr den englischen Markt zugeschickt. Gottseidank hat sich das dann aber schnell aufgekl√§rt, aufgrund der folgenden Punkte:)‚Ä¢ 1 Beschreibung, wie man vom GB-Stecker zum EU-Stecker wechselt‚Ä¢ 1 Schraubenzieher, um den Wechsel zu bewerkstelligen (eine Angst: man muss nur 1 Schraube herausdrehen und kein gelernter Elektriker sein)‚Ä¢ 1 schwarze Reise- und Aufbewahrungstascheü§ç Qualit√§t und VerarbeitungDer erste Eindruck ist einer von Wertigkeit und guter Verarbeitung.Die gro√üe, rote Haartrockner-B√ºrste mit Titanbeschichtung liegt schwer, aber nicht zu schwer, in der Hand.Die Materialien sind von guter Qualit√§t und f√ºhlen sich robust an.Es sind bei mir noch keine Borsten ausgefallen oder sonstigen Probleme aufgetaucht.ü§ç Funktion und HandhabungDas Produkt ist gedacht um Haare zu trocknen und gleichzeitig zu k√§mmen und Volumen zu kreieren.Eine gewisse Haarl√§nge ist hierbei von Vorteil, da der Durchmesser des Volumisers schon richtig gro√ü ist. F√ºr optimale Ergebnisse sollten die Haare, meines Erachtens, mindestens kinnlang sein. F√ºr k√ºrzere Haare bietet der gleiche Hersteller andere Modelle an.Ich selber habe sehr lange Haare, und kann das Stylingtool ohne Probleme benutzen. Ich war am Anfang etwas besorgt dar√ºber, dass sich die meterlangen Haare in der B√ºrste verfangen k√∂nnten, bin aber positiv √ºberrascht worden: nichts hat sich verheddert oder verfilzt. Herausgekommen sind nur gek√§mmte, trockene Haare.Ich w√ºrde es Menschen mit l√§ngeren Haaren empfehlen, die einen Gl√§ttungseffekt und weniger abstehenden Frizz erreichen m√∂chten.Einen Volumen-Effekt habe ich bei mir nicht feststellen k√∂nnen, was aber wohl daran liegt, dass ich sehr feines, seidenglattes und unm√∂glich langes Haar habe. Volumen ist eine Sache der Unm√∂glichkeit bei mir. Leider auch mit diesem sch√∂nen Ger√§t.Was ich aber wirklich super daran finde, ist, dass sich meine Haartrocknungszeit drastisch reduziert hat, seit ich es benutze! Normalerweise muss ich meine ellenlangen Haare nach dem Waschen erst einmal entwirren, dann trocken f√∂hnen, dann durchk√§mmen. Mit dem Volumiser verk√ºrzt sich die Prozedur auf einen einzigen Schritt! Die Kunststoff-Borsten entwirren die Haare vom Ansatz bis zur Spitze und die ausstr√∂mende, warme Luft trocknet sie gleichzeitig.Nach ein paar Min√ºtchen ist man fertig und die Haare sind glatt und gl√§nzend.Ich habe zwar nicht mal einen Anflug von lockigem Haar, kann mir aber vorstellen, dass man so eine sehr sch√∂ne Gl√§ttung erreicht (vielleicht nicht ganz so glatt, wie mit einem Gl√§tteisen) und die M√§hne besser b√§ndigen kann.Ich finde den Volumiser, trotz seiner Respekt einfl√∂√üenden Gr√∂√üe, nicht unhandlich. Er liegt gut in der Hand (Vorsicht: ich habe sehr gro√üe H√§nde, f√ºr eine mittelgro√üe Frau), und f√ºhlt sich nicht schwerer an, als mein normaler F√∂hn.Die verschiedenen Betriebs-Modi werden unten am Griff, durch Drehen, eingestellt. Ich finde nicht, dass man das einh√§ndig erledigen k√∂nnen muss, da ich nicht st√§ndig die Temperatur oder die St√§rke wechseln m√∂chte, w√§hrend ich meine Haare ‚Äútrockenb√ºrste‚Äù.ü§ç FazitEin Ger√§t, das einiges kann und dabei nicht zu hei√ü l√§uft.Besonders praktisch, um die Haare schonender zu gl√§tten, als mit einem Gl√§tteisen, oder sie schnell zu trocknen und durchzuk√§mmen in einem.F√ºr unglaubliches Volumen muss man wohl eine andere Technik anwenden oder einfach eine andere Haarstruktur haben, als meine Wenigkeit. Es sollte aber nicht unm√∂glich sein, da die Bedingungen daf√ºr erf√ºllt sind: Hitze + B√ºrste.Ich finde den Revlon ‚ÄúHaartrockner und Volumiser‚Äù praktisch und benutze ihn gerne.Man sollte ihn einfach selber ausprobieren. Wer dann nicht zufrieden damit ist, sollte die Verpackung aufbewahren, die Haare sorgf√§ltig entfernen, und kann ihn dann sehr gut weiter verschenken. Er eignet sich wirklich ideal als Pr√§sent, da auch die Verpackung sehr hochwertig wirkt.Ich kann dem Produkt nur 5 Sterne geben. Es spart mir Zeit und Nerven, und das ist viel Wert!
title: REVLON Salon One-Step Haartrockner und Volumiser

text: Der "REVLON PROFESSIONAL Salon One-Step Haartrockner und Volumiser ‚Äì Neue Pink Edition (One-Step, IONEN- und KERAMIKTECHNOLOGIE, mittlere bis lange Haare" verspricht ein guter Haartrockner und gleichzeitig Voluminiser zu sein und dass man nach der Anwendung aussieht, als ob man vom Friseur kommt. Gleichzeitig sollen die Haare mehr Glanz bekommen und geschont werden. Ob das Ergebnis wirklich so aussieht wollte ich mal ausprobieren und habe ihn bestellt.Er wird in einem Karton geliefert auf dem alle Vorteile und Bestandteile in mehreren Sprachen beschrieben sind. Das Ger√§t an sich ist nochmals mit der Gebrauchsanweisung in einer Plastikt√ºte verpackt - welche umwelttechnisch unn√∂tig ist.Die Farbgestaltung ist in PINK - meine absolute Lieblingsfarbe - und schwarz gehalten. Das Ger√§t an sich ist ziemlich gro√ü und klobig, anders als ich dies sonst von einem Lockenstab √∂. √§. gewohnt bin.Der REVLON PROFESSIONAL Salon One-Step hat eine sehr gute W√§remverteilung und gute Trockenleistung. Ich habe ihn sowohl bei vorgetrocknetem Haar als auch bei handtuchtrockenem sehr nassen Haar getestet. Auch das Endergebnis kann sich bei l√§ngerem glatten Haar wirklich sehen lassen und gl√§nzt sch√∂n. Das Volumen bekommt man zum Ende der Trocknung sehr gut zu Stande durch die breiten weichen Stachel, die man einfach noch mal am Haaransatz einschiebt und kurz dort h√§lt. Auch Schwung an den Haarenden bekommt man durch die Biegung sehr gut zu Stande.ABER:In der Anwendung finde ich ihn allerdings etwas umst√§ndlich. Die Bedienung ist als Drehschalter am unteren Griff angebracht. Dort kann man die beiden Trockenstufen und die Coolstufe leicht einstellen. Dies gestaltet sich beim Trocknungsvorgang aber schwierig, weil man ja Haarstr√§hnen und Trockner h√§lt - hier fehlt mir einfach die dritte Hand um zur Coolstufe umzustellen. Ich w√ºrde einen gewohnten Schiebeschalter am oberen Griff einfach besser finden, da man den dann einfach mit dem Daumen bet√§tigen k√∂nnte.Was ich auch nicht so gut finde ist das Gewicht des Ger√§tes. Er wird zum Ende des Trockenvorgang immer schwerer und schwerer, so dass ich es kaum noch halten konnte.Au√üerdem bekomme ich weder die Wellen, die die Dame auf den Produktfotos hat, noch einen ordentlichen Pony damit gef√∂nt. Mein Pony ist bis zu den Brauen lang. Ich habe es genau wie in der Beschreibung steht mit den Wellen probiert, habe mir Youtube-Videos angeschaut und alle m√∂glichen Arten ausprobiert - leider ohne Erfolg. F√ºr Pony und Wellen musste ich wieder meine Rundb√ºrste und einen F√∂n vorholen.Mein Fazit:Der REVLON PROFESSIONAL Salon One-Step Pink Edition ist ein eigentlich ein guter Haartrockner und Volumiser f√ºr alle die mittlere bis lange Haare haben und diese komplett glatt tragen m√∂chten.Die Trocknungsleistung ist sehr gut und auch Volumen bekommt damit ganz gut hin. Aber das Ger√§t empfinde ich als ziemlich schwer und k√ºrzeren Pony sowie Wellen bekomme ich damit auch nicht hin. Die Bedienung ist etwas umst√§ndlich durch den Ring am Ger√§testil.
title: Guter Haartrockner + Volumiser mit Verbesserungspotential

text: Der Revlon One-Step Volumiser Plus (Warmluftb√ºrste) ist optisch sehr gelungen und liegt auch noch prima in der Hand.Wer viel unterwegs ist, wird es zu sch√§tzen wissen, dass der B√ºrstenkopf sich abmontieren l√§sst und das Set platzsparend verstaut werden kannDas Ergebnis ist aber nicht nur von den technischen M√∂glichkeiten abh√§ngig, die bei der Revlon Warmluftb√ºrste zumindest theoretisch √ºberzeugen, sondern ganz arg von der Beschaffenheit der Haare.Da ich sehr langes, d√ºnnes und feines Haar besitze, bekomme ich nichtsdestotrotz kein Volumen in die Haare. Wohingegen meine Schwester mit den dickeren und etwas struppigeren Haaren sehr viel Volumen in die Haare hinein bekommt!Aber trotzdem verwende ich die Warmluftb√ºrste gerne und regelm√§√üig, weil meine Haare schonend getrocknet und gleichzeitig gegl√§ttet werden.Die Bedienung ist im √ºbrigen sehr einfach und selbsterkl√§rend, √§hnlich die eines F√∂hns.Preislich liegt das Ganze √ºber dem, was die Mitbewerber anbieten, aber da ich die Qualit√§t dieser Ger√§te nicht kenne, ist ein Vergleich schwierig!Ich bin jedenfalls zufrieden mit der Warmluftb√ºrste und dem Verkaufspreis von 70 ‚Ç¨.¬†üëç

text: Ich habe von Natur aus dunkelbraune Haare, welches ich regelm√§√üig blond str√§hnen lasse. Durch das st√§ndige blondieren sind meine Haare sehr trocken und frizzy. Wenn ich meine Haare nicht f√∂hnen w√ºrde, k√∂nnte ich mich nicht unter Leuten trauen üòÑ Fr√ºher habe ich es versucht meine Haare mit einer Rundb√ºrste und F√∂hn zu trocknen, was ich aber schnell aufgegeben habe, denn meine Haare haben sich st√§ndig in der B√ºrste verhangen und oft habe ich mir damit Haare rausgerissen. Da ich am Ende nicht zufrieden war, wurden meine Haare gegl√§ttet mit einem Gl√§tteisen.. text: Wenn ich den Markenname ‚ÄúRevlon‚Äú h√∂re, dann denke ich recht schnell an meine Friseurbesuche. Der Hersteller Revlon, r√ºstet ebenfalls viele Friseursalons aus. text: Die Marke REVLON d√ºrfte wohl nahezu jedem gel√§ufig sein, geh√∂rt diese doch zu den weltweit f√ºhrenden Marken in der Kosmetik. Als ich durch Amazon das Angebot bekommen habe einen Revlon Haartrockner kostenfrei testen zu d√ºrfen habe ich das Angebot gerne angenommen. In den vergangenen Jahren habe ich schon das eine oder andere Ger√§t f√ºr meine Frau gekauft und dadurch schon einige Erfahrung mit en Ger√§ten gesammelt, doch was ich hier erlebt habe, war f√ºr mich dennoch neu und positiv √ºberraschend.Nach der Bestellung des Ger√§ts √ºber Amazon wurde das Testobjekt schnell, sauber und sicher verpackt geliefert. Beim Auspacken des Ger√§ts f√§llt einem sofort die hochwertige Verpackung des Ger√§ts auf, die einem das subjektive Empfinden gibt, dass man ein sehr hochwertiges Teil vor sich hat. Eine kleine √úberraschung war der Hinweis, dass man vor der ersten Benutzung erst den Stecker des Kabels auf den deutschen Haushalt umbauen muss. Damit erkl√§rt sich die Typenbezeichnung des Ger√§ts RVDR5279UKE, die darauf schlie√üen l√§sst, dass das Ger√§t origin√§r f√ºr den britischen Markt produziert wurde, aber nach dem einfachen Umbau des Steckers auch v√∂llig problemlos in jedem anderen europ√§ischen Land verwendet werden kann. Nach dem erfolgreichen Umbau habe ich mich erst mal schlafen gelegt und gespannt darauf gewartet, was mir wohl meine Frau √ºber das Ger√§t erz√§hlen w√ºrde: Also, das Teil liegt ja super in der Hand, l√§sst sich total sch√∂n im Haar drehen, ohne dass es sich verheddert. Die Spitze (des Haartrockners) wird nicht hei√ü, l√§sst sich stufenweise einstellen und passt sich automatisch der Haarst√§rke an. Das ist ja viel besser als mit Rundb√ºrste und F√∂hn zu arbeiten und dank des Drehgelenks verheddert sich das Kabel auch nicht. Kurzum, meine Frau war restlos begeistert und hat sofort alle anderen Ger√§te verabschiedet.Soviel Begeisterung auf einmal kenne ich sonst von meiner Frau nicht und habe mich daraufhin selbst l√§nger mit der Technik des Ger√§ts besch√§ftigt. Basierend auf der Ionen-Energie trocknet das Haar nicht nur schneller, sondern es wird auch eine statische Aufladung vermieden. Die Titanium Beschichtung hingegen unterst√ºtzt bei der Vermeidung von Hitzesch√§den und damit einhergehenden Haarbr√ºchen. Das Ger√§t selbst hinterl√§sst einen hervorragenden Eindruck in der Verarbeitung, w√§hrend das 3 Meter lange Kabel viel Bewegungsfreiheit erm√∂glicht. Die Gefahr des Verhedderns des Kabels wird durch das Drehgelenk eliminiert. Das Thema Gewicht sehe ich dagegen als ein extrem subjektives Empfinden, was ich an einem banalen Beispiel verdeutliche. Ich pers√∂nlich bevorzuge mit schwereren Messern zu arbeiten, da ich gerne auch etwas in der Hand liegen mag, wohingegen meine Frau naturgem√§√ü filigranere Messer bevorzugt. √Ñhnlich gelagert ist die Thematik mit dem Gewicht des Ger√§ts. W√§hrend meine Frau damit kein Thema hat, mag es jedoch andere Empfindungen zu dem Thema geben. Insgesamt betrachtet halten wir aber den Revlon Haartrockner f√ºr ein hochwertiges Highend Ger√§t, das uns vollumf√§nglich √ºberzeugt hat. Dass aber auch der Hersteller von seinem Ger√§t √ºberzeugt ist, zeigt sich bei der Produktgarantie, die von Revlon f√ºr vier Jahre gew√§hrt wird. Damit ist das Ger√§t eine ganz klare Empfehlung.
title: Ein hochwertiges Highend Ger√§t, das sofort √ºberzeugt

text: ¬†Einfach toll, ich benutze diese Art von Haartrockner zum ersten Mal und ich finde, dass er ziemlich bequem und schnell ist!!!B√ºrste mit Hei√üluft Revlon One-Step ist sehr bequem in der Anwendung, verheddert sich nicht im Haar und erreicht die Kopfhaut so weit wie m√∂glich f√ºr mehr Volumen.Es hat vier Funktionen von Betrieben Graden: Kaltstrahl und drei Graden warme Luft, was gro√üartig ist.ch bin froh, dass ich den F√∂n ausprobieren konnte, der zwei Schritte in einem macht: Bisher musste ich meine Haare zuerst trocknen und dann mit einer Presse stylen, jetzt mache ich das in einem Schritt, was super ist weil es mir viel Zeit spart, fast eine Stunde.

text: Ich finde die Hei√üluftb√ºrste von Revlon mega toll und m√∂chte nicht mehr auf sie verzichten. text: Zugegeben: Das Ger√§t ist schon relativ volumin√∂s und somit auch kein Leichtgewicht. text: Wir k√∂nnen uns der anderen Rezensionen nur anschlie√üen: Das Ger√§t ist schon in der Hand ein "dickes Dingen" - zumindest in den H√§nden von Frauen. text: Der F√∂hn ist sehr einfach zu benutzen. Im Gegensatz zu dem Gl√§tteisen kann man das Haar gl√§tten, ohne Volumen zu verlieren. text: I can't give it 5 stars. My drying time has gone from 20mins (result: very dry hair) to 30-40mins (result: nicely styled hair).I did my research before buying this product because I wanted to make sure I bought the right product for my long, VERY thick hair.... and it seemed like this was the best choice, which it might be (maybe theres no perfect tool for the amount of hair I have). My issue is, I still have to divide my hair in layers for this product to work and even then, I can never fully dry my roots, so the first 3cm of my hair need to air dry, which just leads to frizz anyway....So I cannot give this product 5 stars. I'm very happy with it though.

text: Easy and smooth flow on the hair when oils and a heat protective applied (haven‚Äôt tried otherwise). Brush has both thin longer plastic pin tipped and short soft bristles that holds the hair very well but doesn‚Äôt pull or harm the hair. Shining of the hair after application is very good but for a saloon blow out you need to spend some time on your hair like 25-30 minutes for a mid length 75% dried hair. The brush is still quite big, very good for mid to long hair (no idea for short hair). Good to have the heat adjustment in the order of ‚Äú0-cool-1-2-3‚Äù cooling before turning off the machine is useful. The machine is not heavy but big, not very convenient for backpack traveling, still detachable brush is well thought. When compared to the rotating alternatives I liked this one more as there is no need for a speed control. When compared to 1000 watts alternatives the heat and strength of the hair flow is very sufficient in REVLON one-step plus. The only thing I wish there was a second brush is provided or other REVLON attachments are purchased additionally.

text: Just in the last two years alone, I have bought and returned 8 hairdryers including the Dyson dryer! I‚Äôve also tried T3 Featherweight, a CHI dryer, BaByliss Pro Ferrari Volare, one that was 2000 watts and many more. Before purchasing this Revlon dryer my go to was called Inferno. I‚Äôve also purchased every hair gadget ever invented!Scroll way to the bottom to see my updates!!!In my never-ending quest to reduce drying time with a bonus being able to eliminate my flat iron (which I honestly thought would never happen as I'm no newbie to hair products), I researched and purchase Revlon‚Äôs One Step Hair Dryer. Holy Smokes!!! I love it!Here's my review after one week of using.Why it‚Äôs so great:- I can go from sopping wet to fully styled, with no flat iron in 12 minutes! (was 30 before)- Powerful wind (shockingly), so it dries your hair while you style it- Has 3 settings, cool, low and high (and the settings are at the bottom of the handle so you won‚Äôt accidentally change or turn it off-and the high is great, not scalding hot like some dryers)- Oval brush, this is the INGENIOUS part of this design!!! The brush also has shorter bristles that grab your hair and works JUST LIKE having your hair blown out at the salon (I showed my friend who is a stylist and said this product would put him out of business if his clients knew about it). It grips and puts tension while drying so yes, it's about the size of a paddle brush with oval sides, and curling is likely not an option.- Grabs even shorter hairs. Many reviews said it wasn't good for shorter hair so I was surprised with my results. The back of my hair is just above the nape of my neck, so the shortest hairs could be maybe 2‚Äù long AND, I'm using it on my bangs!- I don‚Äôt have to use a flat iron any more and I look like I walked out of the salon- On the days when I don‚Äôt wash my hair, I've been use a spray bottle to mist my hair, and take a quick 3-5 minutes with the dryer and again, salon like quality, no flat iron, not even on my bangs! (see picture attached)- Lightweight, but a word of caution, the handle is a bit bulky. If you have tiny hands or problems with your hands it could be an issue- Adds volume! I‚Äôm not using any volume product before or after styling. As someone with thick hair you would think volume wouldn‚Äôt be an issue, however thick hair is also heavy hair.I‚Äôm hoping to see a huge improvement in the health of my hair and reduction of split ends as a result of this dryer and no flat iron over the next few months.More About My Hair (should it be of interest)I have thick hair, not curly, not straight. Shoulder length in the front shorter in the back (like pretty short and barely pony tail possible), Lob style. If I didn‚Äôt style my hair in the morning or after blow drying, it would be a mess. (like what your hair probably looked like when you were 8 years old and just got out of bed kind of hair.) I even have a pretty cool contraption that suction-cups to my mirror, holding my traditional hair dryer so I could dry using both hands.  I could never leave my hair wet or even damp, because it would never dry. I can't go to bed with wet hair as it's still really wet in the morning. Again, thick hair.It would take on average 15-20 minutes to just dry my hair. (at the salon, the stylist books an extra 15 minutes for me) Then a flat iron or curling iron because my motto before this dryer was ‚Äòif you want good hair you need hot tools and that‚Äôs the price you pay for good hair." And I was willing to pay the price!Needless to say, I had to carve out time to wash my hair. It was a big production, so to the flat iron I would go in between washes, with massive split ends being created every day.I've attached a selfie taken just this morning of my 2nd day hair. I used a spray bottle this morning, misted and dried. That volume - yeah, that was NEVER there with a flat iron!March 7, 2019 Update: Still loving this hair dryer!!! Everything I said above still stands and my hair is much healthier. I have recommended this to many friends and family and they have also found the same to be true. I always have a backup one in box just in case as I can't be without it! In the past year I have bought 4 back ups because each time I talk with a friend/family member about this dryer, they want one right away so I sell them mine then buy a new back up for myself LOL! The second picture I posted is my hair almost one year later, March 7, 2019 and I'm due for my cut in 2 days.IMPORTANT TIPS: I neglected to mention that if you'd like to prolong the life of your hairdrier see if you can find a way to hang it. Because it's a hairbrush essentially  laying it on its side (on the bristles) with the added weight of the dryer I'd recommend hanging this. What I do is fold up the cord in about 6" lengths, wrap a secure tie or clamp around it and hang it by a loop in the cord in my closet on a hook I use for belts. Also, every once in a while you should also clean or make sure they air flow screen near the bottom of the handle is free of dust, lint, etc. You know, the stuff that blocks your hairdryer and clothes dryer. Keeping this clean (for both LOL) allows your appliance to work more efficiently.August 12, 2020 - another update! If you're wondering if I still love this product... I DO! I've posted another picture, so now there's 2018, 2019 and 2020. Earlier this year I bought the Dyson Airwrap which I absolutely love for curls (it's worth it for the curls alone), straight up drying, or pre-drying, for that it's outstanding. At first I thought, ok, I'm not going to need my Revlon One-Step anymore (after having declared my love publicly for it) and tried for 3 months using the Dyson exclusively with round brush attachment, the flat brush and even bought the smaller flat brush attachments, and you know what?! When I do my straight hair style, I'm still using the REVLON! The reason the Revlon for creating straight hair outshines the Dyson, is because of their brush design, and the second layer of bristles. It grabs the hair AND creates tension. Without the tension there's no way to remove those bumps and kinks that my hair wants to create. So, this is still on the top of my list!July 2022 update... still loving this hair dryer! Recently I ran into someone who recognized me from my review here (who did buy a One STEP and loves it!), and reminded me it was time to update this review. I still use my Dyson dryer/air wrap for days when I'm not doing a super straight finish but instead with curls, however the Revlon One Step is still awesome for ultra smooth hair hands down! The grip of the brush is what truly makes it better than Dyson's brush alternative. The last picture posted is me now in 2022 after just using my Revlon One Step.
title: After years of trying and searching for an AMAZING hairdryer‚Ä¶ finally!

text: Ho acquistato questa spazzola spinta dalla voglia di provare un prodotto che, in un corpo unico, avesse spazzola e phon e garantisse risultati da salone.Inoltre avevo necessit√† di avere un prodotto leggero, possedendo un ottimo phon che per√≤ √® molto pesante e mi stanca...Le recensioni entusiastiche e i tantissimi video su YT mi hanno convinto a comprare questa Revlon One Step Plus con testa removibile.Allora, premetto che ho i capelli molto fini, ricci e crespi, per cui devo utilizzare sempre impostazioni di calore non eccessive e tenere a bada il "vento" del phon con la giusta impostazione e il beccuccio adeguato...1. La spazzola Revlon Plus √® molto leggera ed ergonomica. √à dotata di aria fredda e 3 impostazioni di calore: basso, medio e alto.Le impostazioni di aria fredda e calore medio e alto sprigionano molto vento,  il che non aiuta a tenere a bada il crespo...Mentre asciugavo le ciocche con l'impostazione di calore media, vedevo proprio i miei capelli svolazzare e incresparsi.2. A livello di praticit√† √® utile, nel senso che risolve eventuali problemi di coordinazione tra spazzola e phon, tuttavia non sono riuscita a ottenere ciocche perfettamente lisce e lucenti (come si vede in molti video) se non dopo molte passate, e ci√≤ nonostante abbia usato maschere, creme, termoprotettori e simili.  Con spazzola e phon (ho una spazzola Olivia Garden) ottengo risultati decisamente migliori con 3 passate, non con 8!3. Risultati decenti li ho ottenuti impostando la spazzola alla temperatura pi√π bassa (ovviamente i capelli erano asciutti almeno al 70%), ma comunque nulla di soddisfacente, niente di simile a tante messe in piega viste su YT.Forse sono io impedita o forse ho semplicemente dei capelli poco compatibili con questo tipo di prodotti, ma non riesco a ottenere una buona stiratura con questa spazzola.Queste le mie impressioni. Ripeto ho capelli ricci, crespi e molto fini. Credo di avere ottima manualit√†, dal momento che con spazzola e phon ottengo risultati da salone.Per quanto mi riguarda, prover√≤ ad usarla ancora e probabilmente non la restituir√≥ perch√© pu√≤ tornare sempre utile per la sua praticit√†, ma personalmente non mi sembra un valido sostituto a phon e spazzola...
title: Valutate la compatibilit√† con i vostri capelli...

text: ¬†This magical tool has truly transformed my hair, leaving it beautifully straight and silky. While initially, I faced a slight challenge in maintaining the curls and achieving more than two waves, I was determined to master the technique. text: Valido prodotto due in uno per asciugatura e piega, senza comunque tanti altri accessori che poi rimangono inutilizzati. Ho i capelli corti e temevo che il diametro della spazzola fosse eccessivo per la mia lunghezza invece mi trovo bene. text: After scrolling TikTok and seeing this brush everywhere I have decided to give the brush a try since I thought I‚Äôd be much quicker than having to put in rollers. I have naturally curly hair 3b and although the brush does work and achieves a lovely blow out it does not stay. I have tried everything from the colourwow dreamcoat to changing the products, to using it on only 80% dry hair to fully wet hair for the blow out but it does not seam to stay put. Also the brush gets extremely hot which can be painful on the fingers and steam up the room (I think hotter than a straightener). Now the worst part‚Ä¶ I have noticed a significant amount of breakage and split ends after using the brush a couple of times. I have always used good quality heat protectors and ensured to delicately use the brush on my hair. text: 1) smells strange, like melting plastic, when you start it up the first time, but the smell doesn't last more than a few minutes and it didn't stay in my hair (my hair didn't smell weird after)2) it's really loud, so not ideal for a morning person that doesn't want to wake up everyone..3) it is quite heavy (i'm not used to using hot tools on my hair, i'm usually the air-dry type of person), so if you want to brush your strands upwards for more volume or you have very long hair, be ready for the weight because it's an arm workout!4) speeds and temperature settings on the setting ring: off, fast and cool, slow and hot, fast and hot. i personally separate a row from my hair, then do strand by strand, about 2-4 strands by row. i passed once, slowly, at the fast and hot setting, focusing on the hair near the roots, then i go again, but i switch to the fast and cool setting until the strand is cool to the touch.5) i really liked the results! usually my hair dries how it wants..it's usually all over the place (picture with black top). with this, i felt like i got a beautiful blowout! all my hair was swooping inwards.hope this was helpful!

text: I really like using this product, I bought the size for mid-short hair and my hair is just past my shoulders but quite thick.The package is nice and there didn't seem to be unnecessary packaging which I sometimes find with other products.It is bigger than I expected so I'm glad I got the smaller size. It also takes some getting used to with how to hold the brush and the right amount of hair to use - the smaller sections you use, the quicker your hair dries overall I would say as you're not having to repeatedly go over it. I do find it takes more time overall than a normal hair dryer, but it gives you a nicer finish.The bristles aren't too hard and there are two settings, plus a 'cool' setting. The heat can get a bit much if you're not moving the brush quick enough or if the hot air is directly against your skin, and there's no option to hold a cool button to cool the air. Instead, you would have to change the whole setting to cool, which I find difficult whilst I'm using the brush.Using the brush gives you a blow-dry appearance with lots of volume. I find that I don't have to straighten my hair after this at all, whereas I would if I had used a normal hair dryer.Overall, would recommend and think it's worth the money!
title: Worth the money, gives you a nice blow dry appearance!

title: It‚Äôs really good

text: This is good for those who normally dry their hair with a larger brush. It's a much easier process than holding the drying AND a hair brush.This unit is LARGE. It wasn't too much of a problem for me, but if you have smaller hands, and/or little upper arm strength, this might be an issue for you. The unit itself is 13" long.  (See my photo showing the dryer beside a regular sized brush.) The cord length is 6 feet which was plenty long for me, and it swivels at the base which is great for preventing the cord from tangling up.Essentially this is just a huge oval brush that blows air from within the brush. The air intake inlets are at the bottom of the handle. A neat concept and again may work well for you depending on how you normally dry your hair.It has 3 settings. (COOL, LOW, HIGH). I used it on LOW (low heat, low speed) which is the setting I normally use my hair dryer on. It did take a while to dry my hair that way. (I have long (well past shoulder length) fine hair. (Hair drying in general increases the frizziness unless I put a lot of smoothing product in it.)I dried the top part of my head by leaning over and the bristles actually felt really good against my scalp. (Normally I don't do this with when drying with a brush because it would just get tangled up in my hair. But it didn't seem to be a problem with this larger brush and it's "Tangle-free Combination Bristles".)Doing this also created more volume up top than I would normally get with a dryer.I'll be honest. I normally let my hair air dry, often overnight with my hair up in a loose bun on the top of my head so it doesn't get in the way of sleeping. It produces nice soft waves in the morning without any bed head. I feel this is much healthier for my hair than constantly blow-drying it. I also am easily able to go 5 days without washing my hair, and up to 7 days before it starts to look greasy. (It took a long time to work up to this but again my hair is much healthier because of it.) And don't panic, I shower more regularly. Lol! I just don't wash my hair every time I shower.Regardless this dryer is great for the occasions when I do intend to dry and then straighten my hair with a flat iron.Also I'll mention that hair build-up around the brush head will likely decrease the flow of air and potentially harm the unit over time. I made a point of running the pointy end of a comb through the bristles so I could easily pull the hair out when I was done.The unit seems well made and durable, but maybe priced a little on the high side at $62.99. The packaging is top notch. (Embossing, metallic gold ink, matte varnish, gloss varnish, & spot colours. <- I work in the graphics arts industry.) Without a doubt no expense was spared on the packaging, which also contributes to its cost. Not sure that ALL of those details were required for it to stand out on store shelves but obviously somebody does. For me personally I would prefer a cheaper product price in simple but clean looking packaging since it's going to be thrown out anyway. The Revlon brand has been around for a long time and is synonymous with quality. (My last Revlon hair dryer is over 15 years old, and is still going strong.) I think their products will sell just fine without over the top packaging. And when companies start doing any small thing they can to reduce waste and costs - THEN I'm impressed.Regardless, my review & rating is based on the product itself.
title: Good for those who normally dry their hair using a large round brush, like your hairdresser does.

text: Let me preface this with saying I have short hair.Not like the woman has who the raving review and who convinced me to get it, but like pixie in the front and sides and mullet-ish in the back.I really love this! It has made my hair care routine so much more simple.Once I exit the shower, I let my hair towel dry for about 5 mins then I use a wet brush ti distribute my leave in conditioner, then air dry for maybe another 5. (I have fine but thick hair).My tip for short hair is to take a section and roll it in place so the brush does ‚Äúgrab‚Äù the hair. When it starts feeling warm, move to the next section.It looks silly if you leave it because it will be standing up, but once cooled you can gently brush it (I use a wet brush) and it will just give a bit of volume but it will smooth out your locks.For the back, since it has a bit more length, I do actually brush the dryer through with no issues. The rotating bit where the wire connects really facilitates the whole process.After, my hair feels very silky soft and I‚Äôm left with no frizz.I have been recommending this to all of my friends, and I hope you try this out too :)

text: So glad I bought mine while it was on an offer. I have shoulder length fine/medium wavy hair with a fringe. My hair is normally flat and frizzy.  I have always used hot air brushes and especially for my flat fringe. I had the original revlon round brush long ago. Very good quality and for me this one didn't blow to hot on the highest setting. All my brushes have been used on the lower setting. Maybe I didn't use it long enough...Mmmm. My hair was half dry already, and finished it of in 10min. Was fairly big so the bigger brush must be huge. Probably still to big but it did the job on drying and giving my hair body and shape. Gave me a nice sort of bob, smooth hair with minimal frizz. Felt nice.  Not great on my fringe sadly, just to big to get under a small bit of hair and I normally do a sort of ringlet around my cheeks and this didn't work for me also. More wavy than rings. Would be better suited for long hair that is full of body and wavy. It is pretty chunky to hold but I will get the hang of it. I have this brush for my head hair for the body and waves and have bought the revlon round 38mm for my fringe and any round curls.  I also bought the zip up case to contain the brush which is brilliant for storage, hope my other brush fits in it! All in all I love revlon, good brush and would buy it again.

text: WOW! I read ALLLL the reviews and I looked at this for a LONG time before purchasing. I‚Äôm 100% tomboy and totally not a girly-girl. I have super thick curly hair (see before photo) and it‚Äôs dry like a horse‚Äôs mane. I never style it because it takes an hour and a half to 2 hours between blow drier, flat iron and curling iron and I am NOT that girl. Enter this Revlon One step tool‚Ä¶.1- I read all the negative reviews and listened to my hair dresser who warned me about the high setting causing hair breakage ‚Äì I use low setting most of the time, high only on the problem areas and then finish on the cool setting.  (Photo #2 result)2- I used a thermal protectant before I started plus used a homemade Argan and lavender oil after I was done.3- Smaller sections for me worked betterFinished with a curling iron (Photo #3 final result)4- I clean it after every use just like my hairbrush but I have a TON of hair and I clean my brush and this tool after every use. On average, you lose 100 hairs per day and if you only wash your hair 2-3 times per week like me, when you brush, you naturally have a lot of hair in there. I think keeping it clean will help the drier continue to work well without blockage and make it last longer.5- i did not find it heavy or cumbersome.This look took me 30-40 minutes. It was amazing!! The only thing I need to do now is find a finishing hair spray to help it hold. I‚Äôm sold though! I won‚Äôt do this all the time but no more paying $100 at the blowout bar on special occasions. This was so easy, I expect to do it a few times a month when we are doing out or something and I want a different look from my wild-looks-like-i-just-got-out-of-bed usual hair.I‚Äôd highly recommend this tool just be careful with the high setting.

text: I have medium length bleached 2B curly hair with a lot of frizz. I bought this as I cannot get on with using a round brush and a hairdryer, and I wanted smooth hair with root volume.First off: it is excellent at drying hair very quickly. I use on the lowest speed once my hair is 70 / 80% dry and section my hair into rough thirds. The size of the barrel is more than enough  for my hair - I'd say any bigger and I'd find it hard to handle.The hair doesn't get caught when pulling the brush through it and it is demonstrably smoother when I'm done. I cant say too much about root volume as I haven't done a thorough test of that yet, but I imagine with a little bit more patience you can get a decent lift.It isn't going to give you curls, the barrel is too big for that (even though this is the smaller version), but you can get a bit of movement in it. Overall it's perfect for what I need, getting rid of frizz after washing so my hair is smooth and easier to manage for the next few days!

text: I stumbled across this product over a year ago while on Amazon and saw tons of reviews. I actually appreciate reading other people's reviews, but I very rarely post them myself. I feel a bit guilty about this, so today I am writing a bunch of reviews for things I've bought over the past year and a bit.I love this thing. It is really light and easy to use. I have long curly hair that will easily go very curly or frizzy, but it is not a super strong or coarse curl. My hair feels somewhat fine although it doesn't read that way officially when it is curly because it can be so big.I find it really easy to straighten with this dryer. To be honest, I don't like spending much time on my hair, and I would not bother with straightening with a regular dryer. I don't know how other women can stand spending much time on that. This dryer makes it really easy, and so I do style my hair more straight quite often now. I let my hair dry a little bit in the air or towel first, so I'm not putting so much heat directly on it. It's really easy to use, and my arms don't get tired. I can dry my hair to my liking pretty quickly. I don't like my hair to lie completely flat, and it's easy to control how much I try and straighten with this thing. I tend to stop before my hair is completely dry, and put a bit of putty or leave-in conditioner, so that while far straighter than usual, it still has some interesting curves and body. I find it fairly easy to clean hair out of the bristles. If you use high heat, you should be careful of your fingers when holding the edge with the hand not on the handle.I think my only suggestion to the manufacturer for improvement would be to put a little loop on it, so I can hang it up like I do with my regular hair dryer. I have to just stuff it into the cabinet under the sink, when I would rather hang it up.I am really glad I got this, and also thankful to the other women who took time to write reviews that helped me make my decision. As I said, I don't usually bother with reviews, and this purchase is old enough that probably there are other awesome products on the market. But I'm happy with this.
title: Overall great, big change for my hair routine

text: Ho tanti capelli, spessi e lunghi, mossi e crespi. Negli ultimi anni ho cercato delle strategie per poterli disciplinare in maniera duratura, ma l'unico modo √® sempre stato il forte calore (della piastra e dell'arricciacapelli). Dopo aver avuto un parere negativo da un'amica riguardo un prodotto noto ben pi√π costoso, ho deciso di provare una spazzola asciugacapelli che avesse un costo non eccessivo, e ho scelto, dopo essermi documentata, la One-Step Volumiser Plus (abbinata al Revlon Professional UniqOne Classic come termoprotettore). Ho valutato anche alcune alternative, ma la decisione finale √® stata condizionata anche dal fattore energetico di questa spazzola (800w rispetto ai 1200w di altre marche - senza considerare i 1800/2200w dei phon).Al momento ho effettuato due utilizzi, e sono davvero soddisfatta.Dopo aver lasciato i capelli in un asciugamano in microfibra per eliminare l'acqua in eccesso, procedo all'asciugatura del cuoio capelluto con il corpo della One-Step senza spazzola attaccata. Dopo di che inserisco la spazzola e inizio ad asciugare i capelli divisi in ciocche. Non serve troppa manualit√†, e anche le tempistiche sono buone (ovviamente dipende dai capelli e dalle vostre abitudini). I capelli risultano lucidi, morbidi e ben in piega. text: The product was well made and much bigger than I thought.  In fact, it may be big for most women because the handle is quite wide in circumference.It makes a lot of noise. like a small vacuum cleaner.  It has enough settings for most purposes.The thing that I am not satisfied with is the fact that the air pushed is not directable; it goes everywhere.  If you have it against your hair, most of the air will flow out the holes that are on the other side of the tip because it goes towards the path of least resistance.  This causes most of the air to be wasted because it is not being used to dry your hair.I have other hair dryers from Tescom that are smaller than this and their tips are removable so that if the teeth break off I can buy another tip.  The motor on these is phenomenal because they are used every day and have lasted over 10 years.  The motor mechanism on the Revlon is similar and they are pretty noisy.  The tips on the Tescom units have air holes on one side so all the air is directed through these holes to a small area - none of the air is wasted.Further, the Tescoms seem to push more air than the Revlon.  This could be due to the air going everywhere on the Revlon so the pressure of the flow is weaker in any given direction.  To me this is a serious flaw in the design.  The only useful condition for this would be if you had a lot of long hair and you wrap it around the tip so that the air is hitting your hair all around it.  For shorter hair, I do not find it very useful.On a good note, the teeth/bristles of the Revlon are soft and feel good on my scalp.  They are variable lengths so that they will catch short and long hair.All in all, for the same or lower price, I would recommend getting a Tescom hair dryer rather than this one.  I saw some Panasonic ones that look like the Tescoms here in Amazon, but the Tescoms that I got were from Japan and I have not been able to find them locally.I hope this helps someone out there.
title: Air flows 360 degrees and is not directed

text: I am not usually one for doing much of anything to my hair, and certainly not since the 90s when perms and ‚Äúthe wave‚Äù were still a thing (some of you know what I‚Äôm talking about). A busy mom of 4 kids doesn‚Äôt have a lot of time to spend on her hair. But the kids are older now, and every once in a while I see a device that promises ease of use and amazing results. I buy them, use them a couple times, and then they sit, abandoned, in the dark reaches of my under-sink cabinet. Too complicated for me to figure out with my short attention span, or doesn‚Äôt hold to the ‚Äúfabulous results‚Äù it claimed in the ad. This, however, is different. I had seen it used by several youtube reviewers and it seemed easy enough that even I could figure it out. It popped up on sale, so I bought it, and honestly couldn‚Äôt be happier with a hair styler tool! It dries and straightens my naturally wavy hair, and leaves it super shiny and soft to boot! And it stays straight for days! No waking up in the morning to waves trying to come back in the night, or things getting frizzy. Just run a paddle brush through with a touch of dry shampoo and you‚Äôre good to go! The only thing (and it really is such a small thing), is that the temperature dial is a bit hard to use, being at the base of the handle and kind of hard to see, especially if your hair is all up in the brush and you‚Äôre wanting to get a quick cool shot to set it, there‚Äôs a bit of fiddling, and the tip at the end of the brush part gets kind of hot to touch after a while, but aside from that, it‚Äôs become my new favourite thing to use! Definitely buy!!

text: I bought this along with Drybar's Single Shot blowdryer. I actually like Revlon's much better because the heat is hotter and provides better hold for curls/waves. I returned Drybar's and then debated with myself for a long time if I should keep this Revlon one. After much contemplation, I decided to also return this Revlon one because I honestly don't blow dry my hair that often and I still have my regular T3 blowdryer which actually does the same job. The benefit of the Revlon one is that it's probably more convenient when traveling, so that you don't have to bring a separate round barrel/bristle brush with you. Having said this, when I do travel, I mostly go to Europe and Asia which makes bringing electronics very difficult. I honestly just use the hotel's hair blow dryer, so I feel like I don't really need the Revlon (nor any other blowdryer). This Revlon blowdryer is still a great product, but since I still have my T3, I just don't really need another product that essentially does the same job.

text: I have fine blonde highlighted mid-length hair with a fringe. As I‚Äôm travelling soon I hoped this might replace a bulky hairdryer and round brush combo. It does give some nice flips in the front sections and makes the back look more like a salon blow dry but if you have fine silky hair and are after volume this isn‚Äôt the tool for you. I think it would be better suited to thicker hair types with natural volume because it does look similar to a salon blow dry which I happen to dislike due to the flatness. Also the front section flips don‚Äôt last in my hair so for me it‚Äôs kind of pointless. I mostly used it on the low setting as the high was too hot for my hair type and it‚Äôs quite noisy. text: Looking for a new hairdryer that helps straighten and smooth, I came across this Dryer hair brush. Never having used one before I was dubious, but I read the reviews and thought I'd give it a go. It arrived yesterday and I tried it today. At first I couldn't get the hang of it, but I soon did, I'm not sure if it was quicker then the hairdryer as it took a while to dry the roots, but as my hair started to dry it took shape. I'm also not sure if it's as smooth as when I use a paddle brush and hairdryer, but it was a lot easier and it didn't make my arms ache, so that's a definite positive. On the high setting it is very noisy so be aware of that if you come to use it early morning or evening when others could be in bed. All in all I'm happy with the results, I got the style my hair is cut into. And no doubt the more I use it the quicker I'll get.

text: Let me start with the results before getting into my mini essay of a review. I go from 4c super short kinky hair to almost bone straight bra strap length hair in under 30 minutes. To get anything close to this blow out texture I used to have to blow dry with a denman brush afterwards flat ironing. The latter process took HOURS, sometimes a whole day and it was PAINFUL.I bought this product approximately on November 30th 2020 today is December 23, 2020. Happy Holidays! I have since used this product 4 times. Once on a pre blowdried hair to quickly get my bangs straight in an emergency (haha), once on fully drenched hair, twice on semi dry hair. This is coming from a woman who previously blow dried her hair once a year because the process was too much time, pain, and effort in comparison to air drying via twists or braids. If you have kinky hair you know the struggle.Some reviewers have claimed damage. Therefore I wanted to wait until using this product a decent amount of time before posting my review (after the first use I cried and wanted to immediately proclaim my love as a review). I have experienced zero breakage. In fact my denman brush + normal blow drier combo caused more "shedding" in comparison. I haven't experienced an increase in split ends (I will update later if I do). When I wet my hair it goes back to its very short kinky texture. It has loosened and defined my curls a bit when prepooing but once fully drenched after washing my hair goes back to the 4c, shrunken to my scalp from bra length, unperceivable curl pattern we all know and love.The only problem I see occurring is finding a way to clean the bristles as build up from leave in conditioner and heat protectant will occur. But since the bristles are connected to something electric normal forms of brush cleaning would obviously lead to short circuiting. I'm just planning on crossing that bridge whenever I get there.TLDR: Get it, you will not regret it. <3
title: Review from a 4c textured user. Get it, just get it!

text: Premetto che ho capelli lunghi, sottili e tendenti al riccio, quindi tendenzialmente voluminosi, secchi e crespi. Mai trattati o colorati. Solitamente uso la piastra una volta dopo averli lavati e asciugati con il phon, non tanto per averli drittissimi ma almeno in ordine. Se tento una piega liscia con il phon prima di usare la piastra, l'effetto finale mi dura di pi√π, ma una passata di piastra serve sempre. Speravo di risolvere il mio problema di tenuta della piega con questo prodotto, e soprattutto speravo di sostituire phon e piastra con un unico prodotto. Premetto anche che prima di acquistare l'articolo ho guardato numerosi video tutorial e recensioni, e mi sono convinta che questo fosse il prodotto migliore di tutti (escludendo quelli di fascia alta). Pensavo meglio. Ho testato il prodotto pi√π volte, partendo dalle temperature pi√π basse fino a quelle pi√π alte. Pro: il prodotto si pu√≤ usare effettivamente come phon per asciugare le radici, basta staccare la spazzola; l'effetto finale √® bello, una piega in ordine con un po' di volume, cos√¨ come farebbe il parrucchiere con spazzola e phon; si pu√≤ inoltre arrotolare la spazzola sulle lunghezze per ottenere dei boccoli o comunque per dare movimento; infine mi sembra che i capelli rimangano abbastanza morbidi al tatto, meno secchi del solito. Contro: il risultato non dura sui miei capelli, che gi√† poco dopo la piega cominciano ad arricciarsi e gonfiarsi nonostante l'uso di prodotti pre e post piega. Insomma alla fine ho dovuto sempre dare una passata di piastra. A questo punto ho preferito tornare a usare il phon, che rispetto a questo prodotto non mi strappa i capelli in fase di asciugatura. Ho effettuato il reso. Amazon top, l'articolo molto deludente ma magari funziona meglio con altri tipi di capello.
title: Pensavo meglio

text: First of all, I am a very impatient person and dislike the time it takes to blow dry my hair.  So I was recommended this device by my hairdresser as she knows me and my hair inside and out.  I'm still on the fence if it is quicker than the standard round brush and blow dryer but it does smooth out my hair better than the blow dryer and brush.  However, I wonder if I just bought a bore brush instead of this device would that have solved my frizz problem with the blow dryer.  I do find the device is large and awkward sometimes when maneuvering around...I find that the fact I'm right handed makes my left side always look better than my right side.  It often curls badly on the right side because of the shape of the device and the fact I'm not left handed.  The curls are horrible, ugly ass curls always going the wrong way and have odd shapes to them.  I then need my hair straightener to fix it.  The temperature on the device runs a little hotter than I'd like, even on the low or cool setting.  I have been wondering if the Dyson set would have been the better choice.  My hair tends to frizz more with hotter devices.  I let my hair air dry for an hour and I still need another 20-30 minutes with the device.  My hair is extremely thick and retains a lot of water after the shower.  Even after towel drying.  The quest for the perfect device is still upon me, but this one seems to be okay for the price point, so we will see if practice makes perfect or if my lack of opposite hand coordination will leave me throwing the device out the window in frustration...time will tell ;)
title: Not the best for thick hair, but it will do...

text: I was quite happy with this product until I found out that the product uses Boar bristles. I would not have purchased it had I known this. The previous packaging clearly states the source of the bristles but the new packaging cleverly just disguises it as "natural". I thought the term "combination" referred to the different heights of the pins and bristles. They have a lengthy web page dedicated to them adamantly stating that they are against animal testing but fail to mention they use animal  products? If they've mentioned it, it's probably snuck in some corner. The description for the product mentions " designed with Nylon Pin & Tufted Bristles". The only reference to boar is  the image in the description which you can conveniently read with the microscope you always keep on your person- "Tufted bristles made with boar technology." They used technology developed by boars!!! These creatures have advanced by leaps and bounds. On a serious note, "boar technology" implies that they have artificially recreated boar bristles, which ofcourse one would assume to be made from nylon/plastic and could also be categorized as natural (shaped). However, I did look at the bristles closely and random tips( sometimes entire bristles) are white, just like bristles found on actual boars.There have been questions posted about this on this very page but have not even been acknowledged by Revlon. I still haven't come across any article or web page saying "THIS BRUSH USES BOAR BRISTLES" just like their old packaging. I have emailed Revlon as well, they say that they respond to all queries within 48 hours (working days) and I will update my answer when they reply/don't reply.Revlon, please own up. The techy boars will thank you
title: Beware- Misleading Packaging! Uses Boar bristles

text: I love this product. Super easy to use and has high, low, and cool air functions (and you won't accidentally change the setting your in while using like with some hair tools- or maybe thats just me).I have thick wavy and curly hair and this product basically the only way I can wear it straighter....I don't love flat irons and normally I will use a diffuser and wear ny hair curly, but because my hair is so weird, brisging it is never an option unless using a flat iron.This product is pretty much perfect for me (if I don't want to rock my curls). I do still need to use my small flat iron to flatten some of my more outrageous areas, which for me are under the tip layer of hair close to my face. This is so I don't have strange kinks in these areas. The Revlon brisg seems to take care of all the rest of the curls, I just do this for a little more uniformity. And it isn't technically a straightening product.If you're wondering about frizz I definitely get way less with this than I do if I blow dry my hair straight or or diffuse it curly. I do still get a bit though, but I also have a fair bit if broken hair, and I don't always treat it with love. A smoothing serum goes a long way of you are worried about frizz. I also use it on the lower setting because it is quieter and I think it is less frozzy that way.All in all just buy it. If you have ling stupid hair like me it is a fantastic product. OH and no pulling! It does collect loose hairs as expected but it isn't tearing anything out which is fantastic!!!

text: Okay so I was super skeptical about this product.. Mostly because I have zero abilities to do my hair & the price (was a little less than 70$). I was very intimidated at first because it's a lot bigger than I thought it would be & I wasn't really sure what to do with it. But let me tell you.. THIS THING WORKS. My hair is rather long (under my breasts) & frizzy. Normally when I blow dry my hair it frizzes beyond belief and then I have to straighten it back down. With this, all I did was wait until my hair was about 80% dry, then separated it into three sections & passed the brush through multiple times (like combing your hair). This whole process took me about 10-15 mins and I did it while my show was on commercials. This is WAY LESS TIME than blow drying which normally takes me a good 30 mins. The final product is smooth and very soft & doesn't have that dry feel my blow drier would give me. I still have to go over it once with the hair straightener tomorrow morning but I am SO VERY PLEASED WITH THIS PRODUCT. I would buy it again and recommend to my friends. I'm estimating that using this probably took me around 10-15 mins plus maybe another 10 mins tomorrow to pass a hair straightener before I leave the house. I always dreaded drying/straightening my hair because it would take almost an hour. Now I can keep my hair long and shave off about 30 mins off the whole process. This is a GAME CHANGER. I say spend the money, you won't regret it. If I can use it & my greatest hair accomplishment is straightening without missing any sections, you can use this too :)Downsides: It doesn't have a hook or loop to hang somewhere, So I'll have to find a basket or something to let it rest without it being on the bristles. It is rather big so it takes some getting used to in terms of holding & manipulating it.
title: OMG it actually works!

text: SO. I have used this styling product twice and have a few things to say about it. First of all, yes it is a great product so those 4/5 star reviews you're seeing are mostly true. What drew me to buy this product in the first place is the ease of use. For someone like myself who doesn't ever do anything "fancy" and wears their un-styled hair down 363 days a year this product is a godsend. However, if you know what you're doing and are just looking to shave a few minutes off your routine, you will be very disappointed. First off, it does give you somewhat of a blow-dry look but don't expect it to turn out as nice as with a round brush and hairdryer. Because the brush head is so large, you can't get it close to the roots to get that volume. Your mileage may vary but for me, I held it at the roots for a bit as they instruct on the box, used the cool setting to set it AND hairspray and 10 minutes later the top part was completely flat. This is where I think the smaller brush head would win. Secondly, it gets VERY hot ... almost as hot as a flat iron. Maybe I got a lemon and so the temperature doesn't regulate correctly but with mine, I'm afraid of actually holding it close to my head for fear of getting burned. And the cool setting doesn't get cool at all but is more slightly warm. In the next iteration of this product, I would like to see it come with a little built-in loop so that you can hang it on a hook as well as a cord tie.
title: Great product but has some major flaws

text: I was hesitant to purchase this Revlon dryer brush as I have thick & coarse hair which takes work to straighten. I was going to get a more expensive/better quality dryer brush combo to try first as I figured the quality of a more expensive item would serve me better but I decided to try the Revlon dryer brush to see if I liked the concept. Also, there are so many good reviews on this product.To my surprise, this Revlon dryer brush delivered on all counts. It's easy to use, it smooths my coarse thick hair easily and adds volume to the roots, and it dries my hair fast! So much better than struggling with a brush in one hand and a traditional dryer in the other!The only small issue I have is the temperature control is in an awkward place at the bottom of the unit so when you're drying your hair, it's difficult to get to. But otherwise this is a fantastic tool. I was skeptical but I'm a believer now! If you're unsure, try it!

text: I'm quite impressed.  I used the one step hair dryer today (literally waited for a few hours with damp hair for the package to be delivered lol)  and I'm happy with the results.As you can see I have very long hair and medium thickness (natural wave when not staightened).  It took me about 20 minutes to get my hair like this.  I didn't use my blow dry spray b/c I wanted to see how powerful the dryer actually is.  My hair was only damp, as I mentioned, I was in a towel for a few hours while I was waiting on the delivery.  With that said, I'm still impress.  Towel dried hair with my normal dryer and blow dry spray takes about 30-40 minutes then I have to use a flat iron.This blow dryer does get hot. A thermal protectant is a must.  The cool blast doesn't get cool in my opinion.  The cool blast you also have to flick the switch, it doesn't have a button like most blow dryers do.  That is the only negative I would say. That is why I removed a star.As for the weight of the dryer. I found it slightly lighter than my blow dryer. However since the brush is built in I found it so much easier to use then a standard hair dryer and and round brush.Size wise its bigger than I had expected, but in my case I prefer it as the brush is bigger and great for my long hair.All in all I'm very happy with this product.

text: Ok.  So.  I was doing a ton of research on hair tools and figured that with this being a cheap option I‚Äôd get it and see if I liked the idea of using that type of tool instead of just a vented brush and a blow dryer.  When it showed up I was kicking myself.  It is ridiculously big (should‚Äôve checked the measurements...). Whatever.  I figured I‚Äôd just practice and see if it worked.  First time I was not impressed.  I have super fine hair and the whole idea was to avoid damage. It said use the low setting....  That did NOT work.  But!!!!!  On high, it‚Äôs perfect.  Still not too hot.  It is the size of a blow dryer, but that being said that‚Äôs why it works to do the job of a blow dryer!  From soaking wet hair to dry in 3 minutes.  And volume at the roots.  I just brush it through and then hold it at the roots for a moment.  Bam! Done!  Great volume for me is nearly impossible and that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so in love with this giant ugly eyesore, a ridiculous contraption.  Note that it will NOT straighten your hair effectively, not will it curl it.  You will still need to do some heat styling unless lion‚Äôs mane is your desired effect.  But honestly. Super good price, and does a better job than any of the other Anything‚Äôs ive tried.  I work in a salon and the fact that I can get ready so quickly and lazily with this thing should say a lot.  So if you have super fine, colour treated hair, this b* is for you.  But srsly, it is soooooo ugly.... Don‚Äôt be scared.
title: Didn‚Äôt think It was a good idea.  BUT I LOVE IT!

text: I have short, fine, straight, and often processed/dyed hair. I try not to keep my hair sitting on it for too long. Heat damages the hair, no doubt. I am sure using heat defence product can help with that. I don't use those products(I probably should), so I keep the direct contact with the heated shaft short.  It works incredibly fast, it's cut down my hair prep time down to 15 minutes or less. Because there are only 2 heat options (High, Low), I often switch between the two, and "cool" (it's more like room air temp) to keep the integrity of my hair. I get great volume, and my hair looks super healthy on the first day. "First day" only because my hair is easily kinked (even when unprocessed), so after sleeping on it my hair inevitably looks totally messed up.

text: I can't begin to tell you how many different attempts I've made to style my "bone-straight" hair. Back when perms were all the rage (yes, I'm aging myself) I of course tested the style out... my hair being very fine and thin held that perm for less than two weeks. I remember spending ridiculous amounts for a hairstyle only to have it fall out within ten minutes of leaving the salon. Hair stylists couldn't believe how uncooperative my hair was - and I eventually decided that I was not meant to have "styled hair".After years of wearing hair-clips, pony-tails, cutting my hair to a shorter length or trying to trick myself into thinking my long grown out hair looked voluminous... I stumbled across this product. One of the greatest struggles I have in adding style and volume to my hair is how quickly it dries after washing it. Well the Revlon One-Step Hairdryer & Volumizer Hot Air Brush  has finally done what all hair styling tools before it couldn't... it worked! The tips that my hairstylists had given me for years on the use of "lighter" products in my hair would add volume - finally came true.I love this product. It takes me less than five minutes to style my hair after washing it. I follow the instructions of my stylist on what product to put in my hair and then use this to style it. I am never disappointed and it takes next to no time to achieve a great look!I highly recommend this to anyone who struggles with styling their baby-fine and thin head of hair!
title: The best hair styling option out there for fine and thin hair!
