text: I am the 100% original skeptic when it comes to new products like this.But this?  This is the real deal.  I have shoulder length, fine curly hair, and blowing it dry straight is generally a winter thing for me.  Basically, by the time I'm fully dry, I've started to sweat so badly from being under the dryer that I'm frizzing up again.I had very little hope for this...not even sure why I bothered.  I can't say how glad I am that I did.The time it took to dry my hair was cut by about 40%.  And these best part?  I haven't touched my ceramic iron since I bought it.  I can literally acheive the smooth finish I like WITHOUT the added step of the iron.  (Which honestly, fries my thin hair, and I try to use sparingly.)  The amount of volume I can get is awesome too.  I don't need Texas sky-high hair, but I like a bit of volume, especially now that my hair is thinning out a little bit.  (Welcome to getting older ladies.)  Also, I see a lot of people saying that it's heavy.  Yes, it it a bit heavier than the average hari dryer, but the control you have while not having to mess with two items it worth it.  And if I'm not holding it as long......no biggie.My ONLY complaint is basically the same one that some other users have had.  I don't like the positioning of the temperature controls.  I like to be able to dry an area and then hit it with a blast of cool air to "lock" the style.  This isn't easily achieved with the button being on the bottom of the handle.  But no worries!  Not a game changer.If you're on the fence about this.....give it a try.  Worst case scenario - you can return it, but I doubt you will.
title: This item is the real deal.

text: I have naturally curly, colour-treated, fine, long hair. My hair was always pretty soft, until I got significant chlorine damage from the pool. No amount of conditioner, hair masks, oil shots, or any other restorative products helped. My hair looked and felt like I‚Äôd gotten a bad 80s perm, and I was pretty heartbroken.Then I heard about a highly-rated hair dryer brush from DryBar that promised smooth, soft hair, and very nearly bought it. However, the CAD$200 price tag seemed very steep. So, I started looking around for a cheaper option and found this Revlon hair dryer brush for CAD$59. I wanted to know more about each unit, so I watched a review on YouTube where a respected hair expert compared the DryBar hair dryer brush to this Revlon version. I was shocked when the reviewer said she preferred the less-expensive Revlon version. Then I read the reviews on Amazon and they confirmed everything she said, so I bought the Revlon.I was a bit nervous about the purchase at first, because how could the Revlon dryer, at $140 less than the DryBar dryer, be so good? However, the very first time I used it I was immediately 100% sold. My damaged hair went from frizzy, dry, stringy, and constantly tangled, to smooth, shiny, straight, voluminous, and impossibly soft in only 10 minutes! I honestly couldn‚Äôt believe the result.I‚Äôve been using it regularly since and it has truly exceeded all my expectations. I just can‚Äôt recommend it enough. It is sturdily built, easy to hold, very safe, and so well-priced. Well done, Revlon!
title: Goodbye frizzy, tangled hair!

text: I have been buying from amazon for 7 years and this is my first review.Trust me you need to buy this product.#1) I have very thick curly hair and it managed to straighten my hair while giving it very nice volume. My hair layers show more because of the volume it gives.#2) Using a flat iron takes me 1 hour every time. With this product it takes me MAXIMUM 15 minutes with completely wet hair!! I don't have to wake up 1 hour early anymore in the mornings to do my hair!!#3) The brush is so damn amazing, my hair has a lot of knots but it manages to smoothly brush my hair with no pain or tangles!!!! how???? I don't know.#4) I love that the handle rotates completely so the wire never ever gets tangled while using it.#5) I love that it has a lower heat setting than a flat iron so it creates much less damage to your hair.#6) Another really cool thing that I managed to do with this product  is straighten my hair without even sectioning it!!! (It doesn't look as good as when I DO section it but still takes me 15 minutes for both ways and its efficient for days where I'm not going out and feel lazy.)I would note that most people who claim this product doesn't work are most likely brushing their hair with it like it is a regular brush, meaning brushing fast instead of going slow with it. If you brush fast the heat won't have the chance to straighten your hair!!I really can't think of any complaints....I'm trying but there is nothing to change about it or add to it. Life changing product.

text: So, after seeing a lot of reviews, I decided to splurge on this little guy. I was hesitant because I already had a similar drying tool, however I took the plunge because of the raves about the product being a huge time-saver.I have thick hair that was recently cut to a bit below shoulder length. When I say thick, I mean thick! All the Joy's of a lot of hair, coupled with thick wirey strands, flyaway greys (shh don't tell), and waves that make my hair super-unmanageable. I had a hard time believing the "15 minute" reviews. Turns out they were not a lie. I used this tool on soaking wet hair, and I am shocked that indeed, 15 minutes was all it took!Without taking my tresses with product, but on a humid, rainy day, I still got it looking pretty decent in that amount of time. People are not lying... it is HOT. I will probably use the warm setting in the future. I took a few seconds every so often to set it with the cool setting.To give you an idea of what this guy does on a non-expert, I have included a photo of my hair just air dried vs using this bad boy. Note I took the photo about an hour and a half after use. When I first did it, it was even more salon blowout looking, but also, I did not use mousse or anything to hold it in place (late for train).Edit: added a more recent pic after using it with slightly shorter hair.

text: Ok, I‚Äôm actually impressed with this device. I have long thick curly hair and with a regular blow dryer and round brush it would typically take me 45 minutes to an hour. I‚Äôd have section of small pieces of hair to dry properly and then I‚Äôd have to go over with a straightener to remove any kinked hair or tame those little hairs that stick straight up. Needless to say I don‚Äôt straighten my hair often. However, this Revlon one step hair drier has changed my view on straightening my hair. It took 20 minutes. The section I was drying were substantially bigger than I would‚Äôve done before. There were no kinks and as for the fly away hair I placed the drier to those sections and combed through and they were gone. There is a cool setting and a low and high heat. The high heat is hot, but no more that a good regular hair drier. Because you have to twist the handle to change the heat setting, I found this to be so convenient. I went from high to low heat with out ever having to remove the brush from my hair. The drier is not very heavy but, like another viewer pointed out, try to prop the brush part up so that the bristles don‚Äôt get bent over time. An amazing product and great price.

text: I have medium thickness, frizzy, wavy hair. Usually after blow drying it using a hair dryer on medium heat (my hair would be very frizzy and wavy at this point), I would have to take my straightener in the highest heat setting and slowly flat iron it. Sometimes, the top layers of my hair would need 2-3 rounds of straightening to get it straight. This process would take about 30 minutes start to finish.Then I used this styler. I was skeptical at first, especially for the top layers of my hair, but it did the job with one step! I use this dryer when my hair is 50% air dried. Because the surface area is large, I can use bigger sections of hair to blow dry. I use the highest heat setting, and after going through the hair section twice slowly, my hair is straight, voluminous and soft!! Even though the dryer head is large, the hair closest to my scalp gets straight as well. The highest heat setting is appropriately hot... but be careful - my smoke alarm went off cos it was doing the job a bit too well lol! This process took me 15 minutes!Why one star was removed: there is a plastic-y smell when using the product (but my hair itself didn‚Äôt smell that way). The dial to turn it on/off is annoying, especially when I‚Äôm holding a section of hair in one hand and trying to turn the dryer on using the other hand. A button would have been more appropriate.

text: My hair looks nice and shiny. Nicely curled ends which look like a blow out. I cannot for the life of me do a blow out with a separate brush and dryer, especially near the rear of my head, so this 2-in-1 product is amazing for that. I do have a few complaints, however.There are 2 settings with heat: low and high. The low setting is a little bit too low since it takes a while to dry. The hot setting is way to hot and I think many people will burn themselves trying to use it or burn their hair. I always use the low setting, but typically let my hair air-dry 80% first or do a quick blow dry to lightly damp with a regular blow dryer. The machine is also really loud on the high setting... like I want to wear ear plugs loud.I also think they could have made the brush a little less "catchy" on the hair. I need to be careful how I twist it so my hair doesn't get stuck. I lose a decent amount of hair on the brush when I am done. Maybe it is just my hair texture (lots of fine hair that falls out easily), but I think a smoother brush would have worked better for me.Overall a great product that fills a distinct need, but there is room for improvement before I love this.
title: Great machine but limited heat settings and loud

text: I would actually like to give this product 3.5 stars but it's not possible. I'm sure it would be a 5 star product for people with less frizzy and difficult hair. However, the product is made really well and it's very easy to use, although the large handle takes just a bit of getting used to. The brush does not tangle in my fine, frizzy, and curly hair. I like to use it on days when I'm just too lazy or tired to pull out the round brush and the blow drier, but I this doesn't give me results as good as a blow dryer and round brush.Although it's easy to use, my results aren't as good as I was hoping. This dryer will smooth out my curls but I am still left with quite a bit of frizz which needs some touching up with a curling iron or flat iron.The drier doesn't blow very forceful air, which is good because if it was more powerful, it would tangle our hair and cause more frizz. The only downfall is that it takes longer to dry, especially at the roots.You can use the brush to curl under or smooth over the hair. i got back and forth between the two motions.I think anyone with wavy hair or hair that is not as damaged and frizzy as mine would have excellent results. Unfortunately for me, my hair is super frizzy and damaged.
title: Smooths Curl but Not The Frizz!

Because it gives my hair volume on the roots and it helps straighten it. You know like when your hair stylist lifts it? I still have to use a straightener after I use this but it‚Äôs because I need to make my hair more compact and shiny. After the straightener is done my hair is bouncy, lifted at the root and shiny.The hair dryer is easy to twist and turn and unlike using a round brush and dryer it does not make my hand and arm overly tired. In comparison, I notice when I let my hair air dry the top of my hair is flat and doesn‚Äôt get as much volume as when I use this brush.Overall very good - just took off a star for drying power on my thick hair.

text: I used to have very short hair (2") and any old cheap blow dryer worked fine.  I started growing my hair (pre-COVID decision), which is straigth and while not completely fine, not full either.  Now it is just above my shoulders.  My old cheap blow dryers seemed to fry my hair and it was a bit of a nightmare so I thought I would try this blow dryer based on the reviews I read.  And I am so glad I did. Even with relatively short hair it is amazing.  I put on a bit of volumizing product prior to drying.  It takes 1/2 the time of my other dryer to dry my hair and my hair feels smooth and full.  Having short hair for years, I never really knew the value of a decent blow dryer.  Each time I use this dryer, I feel that i just came out of the hair salon - which is awesome given that ours are closed right now.  I also don't find it too noisy (as other reviewers have indicated). Don't hesitate - buy this dryer.

text: I previously purchased the knock-off of the Revlon one-step when the Revlon version wasn't in stock. The knock-off version worked really well for the first month but then it started shutting off on its own during use. I replaced it with another knock-off, which worked but after a couple of months I noticed blue sparks inside the barrel when I was using it - probably not the safest thing to have around a head of wet hair! I decided to get the real deal Revlon one when it was back in stock and I am not disappointed. Right away I could feel that it was better constructed, the chord does not get tangled the way the knock-offs did, so I no longer had to unplug it to untangle the chord during use. It also dries my hair faster than the knock-off did. Hands down, knock-off or not, the one-step dryer is the best device I have ever used for my hair - I go from wet, thick, curly hair to straight and dry in a quarter of the time. My advice though, if the Revlon one is in stock - pay the extra $30 and get it. You will feel safer knowing it meets safety standards, and it works just that much better than the knock-off!
title: Get the Revlon

text: Update May 2020:I‚Äôm saddened to say that this dryer damages hair to the max üòûI used it for a few months when first purchased and loved it till I realized my hair was breaking, especially around my face, and the split ends and dryness it caused was awful. ALWAYS use a heat protectant!! Super important for any heat styling product. I recommend frizz ease extra strength 6 effects+ serum. text: Despite the recent negative reviews regarding this dryer, I decided to get one on Black Friday due to the sale- $20 off- and I am thrilled! It does not appear to be a knock off and works brilliantly. The reviews spoke about it damaging their hair and I would argue that any heat tool would do this. I use a heat spray and only use the dryer twice a week and my hair is in great shape. Like anything, the lower the heat and in moderation will protect your hair. I use it on the low setting and it works like a charm. It is faster and easier than using a regular hair dryer and round brush. There are some fly aways around my face but that is to be expected without flat ironing. For reference, my hair is mostly (dyed) blonde, long and has a natural curl. Picture is after sectioning my hair out and drying on low with no finishing flat iron. Worth the money to get it done quicker than the old fashion way!

text: Naturally, my hair is like straw and slightly wavy. It is also somewhat thick. I have never used heat or dying products on it until lately, when I got tired of having this limp and occasionally poofy/frizzy hair. So I started using some moisturizing products like leave in conditioners or argan oil but my hair was still crappy. I changed shampoos and conditioners which helped some but not much. I invested in a straightener and blow dryer but my hair always ended up poofy and dull even when straightened.So I read the reviews on here and decided to give it a try. Wow!!!!!! I used this with a heat protectant spray and my hair is fantastic. Its not professional fantastic, but my hair is straight, little to no frizz, and best of all, almost no poofiness. It's not very shiny (I need to figure out how to do that, not this products fault) but it's nice and neat. I use this all the time now. Even though I tie my hair up at work, I still love what this thing can do. text: I am always disappointed with hair appliances that claim to do more than one thing at time, so I was very skeptical. But I couldn‚Äôt ignore all the rave reviews about this one, and the price was worth the risk if they were right. Low and behold, I was pleasantly surprised and delighted by this dryer-brush combo! Very lightweight for its size and easy to maneuver ‚Äî I especially like the cool tip at the end to hold for extra control. The fan is way more powerful than I expected considering how small the mechanism must be to fit into the handle, and it gets hot enough to style my thick, medium length hair. My drying time is cut down about 1/3 with this appliance, which is a win for me. The bristles are long enough to grab and hold a really decent amount of hair in one go, and the boar bristles help manage flyaways and frizz. The only thing I would improve is to make it less loud, but I feel that way about every dryer i‚Äôve ever owned; but noise level is a small price to pay for drying power. I would happily spend twice as much for this appliance if I would have to purchase it again.
title: Well worth the price! Surprising drying power.

text: I got the genuine Revlon dryer, not the chinese knockoff noted in other reviews. I'll start with the cons - It's much bigger than expected, which makes drying closer to the roots basically impossible. Unless you just use it like a normal brush, instead of drying from under, which makes your hair a bit flat. The low setting doesnt dry my hair, but the high setting is so hot I'm worried itll melt my hair. So hot, hotter than any hair dryer I've ever used. Hot enough it's hard to use to dry all of my (very thin) hair at once. There is no temp option, just low or high or cool. It's much heavier than expected and awkward to use. I dont think I'd take it travelling (one of my review options here) because it only works in North America (clearly stated in ad, and I knew) and it is just too big and heavy to carry around for a trip. Not to mention it would definitely set off a fire alarm in a hotel room for blasting out so much super hot air so quickly. It will take a little getting used to-the cool setting could be cooler.- had to use my dryer and round brush for  my bangs,but it could simply be a matter of practice.What I liked:-the dryer isn't as heavy as I was expecting after reading the reviews.-easy to use-drying time was quicker-the size of the handle was easy to use and did strain my hands-my hair looks AMAZING!!!  I do have fine straight hair,but it was very soft and bouncy all dayIf you are still trying to decide whether or not you should buy this item...buy it! If it works for you the same way it did for me, you'll love it!
title: If you've been waiting to buy it...don't wait!!

text: Nice piece of tech. I have medium length hair of medium thickness. I was considering buying the John Frieda due to its reviews on the US site, but its much expensive in Canada. So, I just run over a wide-toothed comb through the bristles of these. Love the fact that it has 3 settings including the cold one, which is just like air drying - so will take a bit longer to dry. I have a bad wrist but it's not heavy for me. I am not much of a styler for my hair, so haven't tried anything on those lines yet. I would have loved a small loop where the wire starts so that I could hand it behind the cabinet doors. But it doesn't, so I have to keep it on a shelf for now. So far, so good.

text: Bought it based on the recommendations of friends, and I've loved it! text: Life before this product: I‚Äôd spend at least 40 hot sweaty minutes blowdrying my naturally curly hair, making it straight but parched & frizzed-out; necessitating 20 more minutes of flat-ironing; resulting in limply flat hair with dry ends, requiring 10 further minutes of smoothing the ends with a large barrel curling iron. 3 appliances, 2 brushes, soooo much time & heat...it always felt like such a pain for little gain.Life now: I use this Revlon hair tool for TWENTY MINUTES MAX & get super bouncy, STUNNING results that last!HAIR-LIFE CHANGING!!!!!!!!! Honestly, it‚Äôs like a high-end Hollywood blowout. This tool makes me ridiculously happy & I‚Äôve recommended it to pretty much every woman I know.Tips: 1. sectioning out hair gives the best results. 2. as always, use a heat protectant product. 3. though not necessary, I do prefer to wear ear plugs during use. 4. it seems big & awkward at first but you get used to wielding it pretty quickly - the results are beyond worth the tiny learning curve.

text: I'm not super into blow-drying my hair - I don't really have time, but this cuts down on my time significantly when I do and it makes my blow out SO MUCH BETTER. text: I so wanted this hairdryer to be the magical device everyone seems to say it is--but it was not the case for my hair. I have a lot of very fine hair, which is a combo of tight curls by my neck, semi-waves in certain sections, and straight in others. It looks terrible if it dries naturally, so I always have to blow dry it. The pros of this hair dryer: it dried my hair very quickly, which was wonderful for the workdays. It also made my hair silky soft. The CONS: it made my hair more "limp" and close to my head than I've ever seen. For some people this might be a bonus. For me it made me look like I'd lost half my hair (as with normal blow dryers my hair has a lot more volume and body to it).  I tried a few times just in case it was my technique, but each time, my hair looked limp and awful. Very sad that this wasn't the cure-all for me that other reviewers/users have found it to be. I'm giving it to my sister who has very thin hair, hoping it will somehow help her.
title: Made my hair limp without any body, but very soft

text: I just ordered this hair dryer and it arrived at my door in exactly 19 hours.  I couldn't wait to try it out and I can't believe how absolutely amazing it actually is! It just took me not even 15 minutes to dry and style my hair when it used to take me at least 30 minutes.  I love how your hair doesn't get tangled and you can style it any way you want.  I am super excited that I made this purchase and look forward to using it forever! Getting ready for work in the morning won't be so much of a chore anymore!  I noticed that quite a few reviews complained about the size of the handle being really big, but I actually don't find it to be a problem at all. I would definitely recommend this hair dryer to anyone who wants to save time styling and straightening their hair in one easy step!  I can almost guarantee that you won't be disappointed!!

text: I got this bundled with a heat protection spray. And it's really done it's job. Now mind you, getting your hair looking good takes time and PRACTICE. Maybe get someone else to do your hair first and make sure you SECTION your hair. It might seem stupid if you have short hair, but it makes a HUGE difference pinning up your hair and straightening/drying your hair in batches. And don't go too quick with pulling the brush through either! Go at a medium pace and make sure you do the same batch of hair a few times. Maybe 2-3 times tops, so it straightens.I am so happy I didn't get a rip off product and the real deal. Not sure if those other bad reviews are fake about getting a decoy product, but I got the real thing and am SO pleased with my purchase. Thank you for this creation.

text: I used to battle with my hair every day. Had to wait a solid 30 minutes after showering for my hair to air dry a bit before using the classic hairdryer + round brush for 20 minutes, then use the flat iron. The Revlon Volumizer changed the game. I can dry my hair as soon as I jump out of the shower and in less than 8 minutes I have perfectly straight and shiny hair (I finish with the cool setting for a minute or two). I also want to point out that I have multiple sclerosis and that my hands are weak and hurt easily and this tool is easy to use, doesn't cramp my hands and is lightweight. I recommended it to my friends with arthritis and fibromyalgia for this exact reason. I know there is less expensive knockoffs on the market but my friend got one and it gets so hot she burned her scalp, so I went with the original design and don't regret it!

text: Chi scrive √® la moglie di Franco, utilizzatrice finale del prodotto.Premetto che ho sempre considerato la cura dei capelli in cima alla classifica delle necessit√† estetiche femminili. Se hai la testa a posto sei sicuramente pi√π bella, su questo non ho dubbi. Ho speso nella mia vita pi√π soldi in parrucchieri che in vestiti, senza mai pentirmene. Ho comprato questa spazzola dopo aver visto i filmati YouTube per il mercato americano, mi sono messa in lista e quando √® diventata disponibile sul mercato europeo Amazon mi ha avvisata e l‚Äôho comprata. √à un ottimo prodotto, dimezza i tempi di piega, io la uso dopo aver tamponato i capelli con un turbante in microfibra, tenuto in testa per qualche minuto. In dieci minuti la piega √® fatta, bella come dal parrucchiere, i capelli sono lisci, morbidi, lucidi, belli. text: This brush is amazing! I've tried others a long time ago and they all did a terrible job, until this one. A couple of things worth noting:1) If you have curly or wavy hair, it won't dry it pin straight, so it's not a substitute for a flat iron. I personally don't like my hair pin straight, so I'm happy this brush let's me keep my waves and shows off my layers.2) It's not the lightest or the quietest of hair styling tools out there, however in both aspects it's comparable to an average hairdryer. It is definitely easier to handle and less strain on your arms than styling the old way with a hairdryer and a brush.I love how easy it is to use. text: This is crazy to say but I actually prefer this volumizing dryer to my Dyson (that cost so much more).  Why? text: This was a gift to a family member as they were talking about this particular model in the store but the store wanted crazy amounts of money for this hair dryer so i found this SAME model on Amazon for cheaper. I thought i was paying for a genuine Revlon Hair Dryer & Volumizer. I didn't even know this at the time to purchasing the product as i gave to them for a gift. About three weeks later they opened the box to find a 220V plug which i found very weird. I did some research and found by other reviews on Amazon that others were experiencing the same issue. I went to the store and decided to own up to purchasing "The name brand" and found a standard 120V outlet plug on the end. I compared the two, which i am having trouble uploading the pictures but both of the handles are almost different but box is the exact same and leads to be believe that this is the same product so in the end this is the Knock OFF product which is why it's cheaper. I am disappointed because i now am past the return window so what i might end up doing it when the dryer goes i will swap the cords to this one and hopefully it works but it's seems that some reviews are positive and negative which means some possibly have received the real product. At the end if has a Pink Bottom = 220V, if has a Black bottom = 110V.
title: Knock off. Not what i looking was to purchase.
